title: Can animals be held morally responsible for their actions? - Quora

response.answer_text: I answered this for another question. To put it shortly, they can’t. They don’t share our level of morality nor intelligence. That doesn’t mean they don’t have morality, but they have little to none, and survival/ecological manegment on their minds. They don’t have desires or quarrel like us and they don’t kill for fun.

How could I judge if an animal had done some action that offends my morals? If a dog bites, it is either scared, threatened or in deep pain. If a cat scratches me I would figure out how I can prevent this from happening again but the cat would not understand or relate a punishment with the event. There are animals that are put to death for hurting humans. We never hear the animals side of the story. Animals are opportunistic. They might steal food from their friends or people.
